meanings.definition: To engage in noisy revelry or boisterous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children love to roist around the playground after school.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, people often roist in the streets, celebrating together.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors decided to roist loudly in their backyard, much to the amusement of the whole street.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside seemed to roist with thunder and lightning, creating a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends would always roist with laughter whenever they got together.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in noisy revelry or boisterous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The roist in the neighborhood was known for throwing the best parties.
meanings.sent2: At the concert, you could spot the roist dancing energetically in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The little roist at the birthday party was the life of the celebration.
meanings.sent4: She was a true roist, bringing joy and laughter wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The roist's presence at the gathering immediately livened up the atmosphere.
